Project Documentation

minify:minify

Full name:

com.samaxes.maven:minify-maven-plugin:1.4:minify

Description:

Goal which combines and minifies CSS and JavaScript files.

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven project to be executed.
  • Binds by default to the lifecycle phase: process-resources.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
bufferSize int - Size of the buffer used to read source files.
Default value is: 4096.
charset String 1.3.2 If a supported character set is specified, do a byte-to-char copy operation from an InputStreamReader to an OutputStreamWriter using the specified charset. Otherwise, do a byte-to-byte copy operation from an InputStream to an OutputStream, keeping the original file encoding.

See the IANA Charset Registry for a list of valid encoding types.
cssFinalFile String - CSS output filename.
Default value is: style.css.
cssSourceDir String - CSS source directory.
Default value is: css.
cssSourceExcludes List 1.2 CSS files to exclude. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the CSS source directory.
cssSourceFiles List - CSS source filenames list.
cssSourceIncludes List 1.2 CSS files to include. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the CSS source directory.
cssTargetDir String 1.3.2 CSS target directory.
Default value is: css.
disableOptimizations boolean - JAVASCRIPT ONLY OPTION!
Disable all the built-in micro optimizations.
Default value is: false.
jsFinalFile String - JavaScript output filename.
Default value is: script.js.
jsSourceDir String - JavaScript source directory.
Default value is: js.
jsSourceExcludes List 1.2 JavaScript files to exclude. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the JavaScript source directory.
jsSourceFiles List - JavaScript source filenames list.
jsSourceIncludes List 1.2 JavaScript files to include. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the JavaScript source directory.
jsTargetDir String 1.3.2 JavaScript target directory.
Default value is: js.
linebreak int - Some source control tools don't like files containing lines longer than, say 8000 characters. The linebreak option is used in that case to split long lines after a specific column. It can also be used to make the code more readable, easier to debug (especially with the MS Script Debugger). Specify 0 to get a line break after each semi-colon in JavaScript, and after each rule in CSS. Specify -1 to disallow line breaks.
Default value is: -1.
nomunge boolean - JAVASCRIPT ONLY OPTION!
Minify only. Do not obfuscate local symbols.
Default value is: false.
preserveAllSemiColons boolean - JAVASCRIPT ONLY OPTION!
Preserve unnecessary semicolons (such as right before a '}'). This option is useful when compressed code has to be run through JSLint (which is the case of YUI for example).
Default value is: false.
suffix String 1.3.2 The output filename suffix.
Default value is: .min.
verbose boolean - JAVASCRIPT ONLY OPTION!
Display informational messages and warnings.
Default value is: false.
webappSourceDir String - Webapp source directory.
Default value is: ${basedir}/src/main/webapp.
webappTargetDir String - Webapp target directory.
Default value is: ${project.build.directory}/${project.build.finalName}.

Parameter Details

bufferSize:

Size of the buffer used to read source files.
  • Type: int
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.bufferSize}
  • Default: 4096

charset:

If a supported character set is specified, do a byte-to-char copy operation from an InputStreamReader to an OutputStreamWriter using the specified charset. Otherwise, do a byte-to-byte copy operation from an InputStream to an OutputStream, keeping the original file encoding.

See the IANA Charset Registry for a list of valid encoding types.

  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Since: 1.3.2
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.charset}

cssFinalFile:

CSS output filename.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.cssFinalFile}
  • Default: style.css

cssSourceDir:

CSS source directory.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.cssSourceDir}
  • Default: css

cssSourceExcludes:

CSS files to exclude. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the CSS source directory.
  • Type: java.util.List
  • Since: 1.2
  • Required: No

cssSourceFiles:

CSS source filenames list.
  • Type: java.util.List
  • Required: No

cssSourceIncludes:

CSS files to include. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the CSS source directory.
  • Type: java.util.List
  • Since: 1.2
  • Required: No

cssTargetDir:

CSS target directory.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Since: 1.3.2
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.cssTargetDir}
  • Default: css

disableOptimizations:

JAVASCRIPT ONLY OPTION!
Disable all the built-in micro optimizations.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.disableOptimizations}
  • Default: false

jsFinalFile:

JavaScript output filename.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.jsFinalFile}
  • Default: script.js

jsSourceDir:

JavaScript source directory.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.jsSourceDir}
  • Default: js

jsSourceExcludes:

JavaScript files to exclude. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the JavaScript source directory.
  • Type: java.util.List
  • Since: 1.2
  • Required: No

jsSourceFiles:

JavaScript source filenames list.
  • Type: java.util.List
  • Required: No

jsSourceIncludes:

JavaScript files to include. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the JavaScript source directory.
  • Type: java.util.List
  • Since: 1.2
  • Required: No

jsTargetDir:

JavaScript target directory.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Since: 1.3.2
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.jsTargetDir}
  • Default: js

linebreak:

Some source control tools don't like files containing lines longer than, say 8000 characters. The linebreak option is used in that case to split long lines after a specific column. It can also be used to make the code more readable, easier to debug (especially with the MS Script Debugger). Specify 0 to get a line break after each semi-colon in JavaScript, and after each rule in CSS. Specify -1 to disallow line breaks.
  • Type: int
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.linebreak}
  • Default: -1

nomunge:

JAVASCRIPT ONLY OPTION!
Minify only. Do not obfuscate local symbols.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.munge}
  • Default: false

preserveAllSemiColons:

JAVASCRIPT ONLY OPTION!
Preserve unnecessary semicolons (such as right before a '}'). This option is useful when compressed code has to be run through JSLint (which is the case of YUI for example).
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.preserveAllSemiColons}
  • Default: false

suffix:

The output filename suffix.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Since: 1.3.2
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.suffix}
  • Default: .min

verbose:

JAVASCRIPT ONLY OPTION!
Display informational messages and warnings.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.verbose}
  • Default: false

webappSourceDir:

Webapp source directory.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.webappSourceDir}
  • Default: ${basedir}/src/main/webapp

webappTargetDir:

Webapp target directory.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${minify.webappTargetDir}
  • Default: ${project.build.directory}/${project.build.finalName}
